Article Title: Microsoft-backed OpenAI releases advanced voice mode to these users
Article Text:
GPT-4o's has only four preset voice



Sam Altman-led OpenAI has started rolling out its advanced voice mode to a small group of ChatGPT Plus users. Voice mode on ChatGPT was announced earlier this year in May. It enables authentic interactions with the artificial intelligence (AI) chatbot, offering real-time responses without delay and emotional engagements. The advanced voice mode was initially scheduled to release in -late June, but the company delayed it to July to “reach our bar to launch.”ChatGPT Plus is a paid subscription plan for ChatGPT.It offers priority access to new features along with faster response speed and availability even when demand is high.In a post on X (formerly known as Twitter), the company said “ We’re starting to roll out advanced Voice Mode to a small group of ChatGPT Plus users. Advanced Voice Mode offers more natural, real-time conversations, allows you to interrupt anytime, and senses and responds to your emotions.”“Users in this alpha will receive an email with instructions and a message in their mobile app. We'll continue to add more people on a rolling basis and plan for everyone on Plus to have access in the fall,” the company added.Video and screen sharing capabilities will launch at a later date, it added.The company says that it has tested GPT-4o's voice capabilities with 100+ external red teamers across 45 languages. The AI model will only speak in four preset voices – Juniper, Breeze, Cove and Ember – made in collaboration with paid voice actors.OpenAI says that it has built systems to block outputs that differ from those voices. Additionally, it has implemented guardrails to block requests for violent or copyrighted content.OpenAI spokesperson Lindsay McCallum says “ChatGPT cannot impersonate other people’s voices, both individuals and public figures, and will block outputs that differ from one of these preset voices.”
Article Summary: ChatGPT Plus is a paid subscription plan for ChatGPT. It offers priority access to new features along with faster response speed and availability even when demand is high. The advanced voice mode was initially scheduled to release in -late June, but the company delayed it to July to “reach our bar to launch”

Article Title: Why hacker is God in the world of Cryptocurrency and Bitcoins
Article Text:
force majeure' events or 'Act of God' -- beyond their control

Cyberattacks: The Unstoppable Force Majeure in Crypto

The recent cyberattack on WazirX has brought into sharp focus the precarious position of cryptocurrency investors. While the immediate impact is the loss of funds, a deeper analysis reveals a systemic issue: the loophole of ' force majeure '.Cryptocurrency exchanges, unlike traditional financial institutions, often classify cyberattacks as '– in their terms of service.This clause, typically buried in lengthy legal jargon, absolves exchanges from liability in case of such incidents.The WazirX fiasco has ignited a debate about the fairness of this practice. Critics argue that while cyberattacks are indeed challenging to prevent, exchanges profit from handling vast sums of digital assets and should therefore bear some responsibility for their loss.A spokesperson for WazirX defended the industry’s stance, stating that the unpredictable nature of cyber threats makes it difficult to guarantee absolute security. However, legal experts like Supreme Court advocate N S Nappinai point out that while including a wide range of events under force majeure is common practice, it should be limited to circumstances truly beyond the control of the service provider.The incident underscores the need for greater transparency and investor protection in the cryptocurrency market. As the industry matures, it is imperative to establish clear guidelines and regulations to safeguard the interests of users.“In the opaque world of crypto, contract is king. The terms are invariably captured in standard form contracts and not negotiated. Including a wide array of circumstances in a force majeure is standard practice, but the same is ring fenced by those circumstances that are beyond the control of the offeror,” Supreme Court senior advocate N S Nappinai told ET.
Article Summary: Cryptocurrency exchanges often classify cyberattacks as '– in their terms of service. This clause, typically buried in lengthy legal jargon, absolves exchanges from liability in case of such incidents. Critics argue that while cyberattacks are indeed challenging to prevent, exchanges profit from handling vast sums of digital assets.

Article Title: Olympic 2024: France's biggest telecom companies fume as internet lines cut in latest attack
Article Text:
Telecom companies unhappy

A series of coordinated attacks on France's critical infrastructure has continued with the cutting of multiple fiber optic cables across the country overnight. While the incident did not disrupt broadband services in Paris or impact the ongoing Olympic Games, it marks the second such attack in as many days. The vandalism came after arson attacks hit train networks around France on Friday, hours before the Olympics opening ceremony.Telecommunications providers, including SFR , Iliad's Free, and Netalis, reported widespread damage to their networks in nine regions. Although service has been restored through backup systems, internet speeds have slowed in some areas. Cloud provider OVHcloud has also been affected, with slower connections between Europe and Asia Pacific.The French Telecom Federation has called for stricter penalties for vandalism of telecom infrastructure, citing the increasing frequency and scale of these attacks. Authorities are investigating the incident and have not ruled out a connection to the recent sabotage of French rail lines. News agency AFP confirmed with major carriers including Free and SFR that they had been affected."It's vandalism," said Nicolas Chatin, spokesman for SFR, one of France's four biggest operators. "Large sections of cables were cut. You would have to use an axe or a grinder," he told AFP.A source close to the case told AFP nobody had yet said they were responsible for the telecoms sabotage. "What frankly makes us furious is that we feel the state has not realised the importance of these potential attacks on France's strategic infrastructures," said Nicolas Guillaume of Netalis, a specialised operator.As France remains on high alert due to the Olympic Games, security forces have been deployed in large numbers to protect key infrastructure and public spaces. The country is grappling with a growing threat to its critical networks, raising concerns about national security and resilience.
Article Summary: Telecommunications providers report widespread damage to their networks in nine regions. Authorities are investigating the incident and have not ruled out a connection to the recent sabotage of French rail lines. Cloud provider OVHcloud has also been affected, with slower connections between Europe and Asia Pacific.

Article Title: Amazon announces Great Freedom Festival sale: Dates, deals and more
Article Text:
Amazon has announced Great Freedom Festival following Prime Day, teasing major discounts and offers. The sale was expected to start before August 15, with early access for Prime members. Offers included up to 80% off electronics, up to ₹40,000 off laptops, and no-cost EMIs up to 24 months on selected products and brands.

Article Title: ONDC launches interoperable QR code: What it means for customers
Article Text:
Interoperable QR code is in its alpha phase

The government-backed Open Network for Digital Commerce ( ONDC ) has launched an interoperable QR code system to empower small businesses . This QR code allows sellers to create a unique digital storefront accessible through various ONDC-compatible apps.The initiative not only aims to level the playing field for small sellers by providing them with a wider reach compared to traditional e-commerce platforms but also to connect sellers, local artisans and neighbourhood shopkeepers with customers online and offline.“ONDC’s interoperable QR code breaks down the barriers that have held small businesses back. Now, every seller has the power to reach customers digitally, just like the e-commerce giants. It’s a massive leap towards an open, inclusive, and democratised digital marketplace ,” said T Koshy, MD and CEO, ONDC.Sellers can now display their QR codes at physical stores, online platforms, or any other location to connect with customers, said the open network launched by the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT).The interoperable QR code is currently in its alpha phase and will be initially available on Magicpin and Paytm .“Think of the local shopkeeper, the street vendor, the artisan — they can now be discovered and patronised by anyone, anywhere,” Koshy said.“This isn't just a new feature; it's a catalyst for economic growth and digital inclusion. Millions of businesses will come online, creating new opportunities and driving India’s digital economy forward,” he added.The QR code system is expected to expand to other platforms in the future. ONDC believes this move will significantly boost digital commerce in India and promote economic growth.
Article Summary: The government-backed Open Network for Digital Commerce ( ONDC ) has launched an interoperable QR code system to empower small businesses. This QR code allows sellers to create a unique digital storefront accessible through various ONDC- compatible apps. ONDC believes this move will significantly boost digital commerce in India and promote economic growth.

Article Title: UK probes Google parent's partnership with this Amazon-backed AI company
Article Text:
Microsoft’s partnership with AI startups under lens

Google-parent company Alphabet is being subjected to scrutiny by the UK’s antitrust watchdog over its partnership with artificial intelligence startup Anthropic and its impact on competition. Britain's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) has invited comments on the transaction from any interested party, in advance of the CMA ’s formal investigation starting.“The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) is considering whether it is or may be the case that Alphabet’s partnership with Anthropic has resulted in the creation of a relevant merger situation under the merger provisions of the Enterprise Act 2002 and, if so, whether the creation of that situation may be expected to result in a substantial lessening of competition within any market or markets in the United Kingdom for goods or services,” the regulator said in a statement on Tuesday (July 30).The CMA has set a deadline of August 13 for its invitation to comment. After that, it will decide whether to launch an official investigation at the end of this process.Anthropic, which was co-founded by former OpenAI executives, last year said it had secured $500 million in investment from Alphabet, promising another $1.5 billion over time. Other investors in the startup include Amazon , which has invested $4 billion in the Al startup.Anthropic was founded in 2021 and offers genAI models like Claude Al chatbot that competes directly with OpenAl 's ChatGPT.Alphabet is not the only tech giant under scrutiny for its investments in AI startups. Microsoft's partnerships with startups such as OpenAI, Inflection AI, and Mistral AI, as well as Alphabet's ties to other smaller companies such as Cohere are also under various regulators’ lens.Last week, the CMA issued a joint statement alongside its counterparts in the US and the European Union (EU) to work together to safeguard fair competition in the AI industry.
Article Summary: UK antitrust watchdog to investigate Google-parent company's partnership with Anthropic. Britain's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) has invited comments on the transaction. CMA has set a deadline of August 13 for its invitation to comment. After that, it will decide whether to launch an official investigation.

Article Title: Researchers on how China may be closing AI gap with the US
Article Text:
China bets on open-source software for AI development

Researchers and technologists have said that China is rapidly catching up to the US in the race for artificial intelligence (AI) development with a growing emphasis on open-source technology , a report has said.According to the New York Times, Chinese companies are sharing their AI advancements , including underlying code, through open-source platforms, allowing for faster collaboration and innovation within the global AI community .Recently at the World Artificial Intelligence Conference in Shanghai, a video was shown wherein an old photograph of a woman with two toddlers came to life with the use of AI technology similar to Sora – created by ChatGPT-maker OpenAI .While Sora is not available for the public, the technology by Chinese companies are available to the general public.“My American friends still can’t use Sora. But we already have better solutions here,” the co-founder of the startup that made the AI video was quoted as saying.As per Kai-Fu Lee, an investor and technologist who helped build Chinese offices for both Google and Microsoft, and who co-founded 01.AI start-up, said that his company’s chatbot technology scored nearly as well as the leading American technologies on common benchmark tests that rate the performance of the world’s chatbots.“We have disproved the commonplace belief that China doesn’t have the talent or the technology to compete with the US. That belief is simply wrong,” Dr. Lee said.Chinese companies are readily sharing their AI advancements, including underlying code, through open-source platforms. This allows for faster collaboration and innovation within the global AI community.“Chinese companies are good at replicating and improving what the U.S. already has. They are not as good at inventing something completely new that will bypass the U.S. in five to 10 years,” said Yiran Chen, a professor of electrical and computer engineering at Duke University.Recently, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg pointed out that open-source AI software is beneficial for both the developers and the company. Clément Delangue, chief executive of Hugging Face also said that open-source AI is the foundation of AI development. He said that the US built its leadership in AI through collaboration between companies and researchers, “and it looks like China could do the same thing.”
Article Summary: Chinese companies are readily sharing their AI advancements, including underlying code, through open-source platforms. This allows for faster collaboration and innovation within the global AI community.“We have disproved the commonplace belief that China doesn’t have the talent or the technology to compete with the US. That belief is simply wrong,” Dr. Lee said.

Article Title: Google Gemini may soon allow further editing of AI-generated images
Article Text:
Google brings this “Gemini's big upgrade” to free version

Google's AI model, Gemini, is poised to redefine image editing . According to recent reports, the tech giant is developing a new feature that will allow users to make precise modifications to AI-generated images .Currently, users often find themselves starting from scratch when they want to tweak an AI-generated image. However, this upcoming update is set to change that.With the new tool, users will be able to fine-tune images with greater precision, potentially altering elements like background, objects, or even the subject's appearance.Users can simply circle the desired area of an image with their finger or stylus and then provide text instructions for the desired changes. This intuitive approach eliminates the need for complex descriptions, as Gemini will automatically identify the selected region.While Google hasn't officially confirmed the feature, its potential implications are significant. If realised, this development could revolutionise the creative process for designers, artists, and content creators alike.Recently, Google has announced a significant upgrade to its Gemini AI chatbot. The company is introducing the Gemini 1.5 Flash large language model (LLM) to the free version of its chatbot, providing faster response times and enhanced accuracy.“Today we’re upgrading our free-tier experience to Gemini 1.5 Flash. With Gemini 1.5 Flash, you’ll notice across-the-board improvements in quality and latency, with especially noticeable improvements in reasoning and image understanding,” the company said.
Article Summary: Users will be able to circle the desired area of an image with their finger or stylus and then provide text instructions for the desired changes. Google hasn't officially confirmed the feature, but its potential implications are significant. If realised, this development could revolutionise the creative process for designers, artists, and content creators alike.

Article Title: Google Photos makes it easier to hide unwanted faces in Memories, here’s how
Article Text:
How the feature will work

Google Photos is making a significant upgrade to its Memories feature, giving users more control over which faces appear in their nostalgic photo collages. The tech giant is rolling out a new tool that simplifies the process of hiding individuals from appearing in Memories.As reported by Android Authority, Google is now making it easier to hide faces in Google Photos.Previously, users had to navigate through multiple menus to exclude specific people from their photo retrospectives. The new update promises a more streamlined approach, allowing users to directly hide a face from a photo's details page. This change is expected to make the process quicker and more intuitive.While Google hasn’t officially announced a release date for the new feature, it’s anticipated to be available to users in the coming months. This update comes as a welcome relief for many users who have expressed frustration over seeing unwanted faces in their Memories.To hide individuals from Memories in Google Photos, navigate to the app's settings menu, then go to Preferences > Memories, and select "Hide people and pets." This action will enable you to conceal individuals from appearing in your memories, creations, or on the search page without deleting any of the photos they are in.The report mentions that Google has simplified this process by reducing the number of steps. As per the APK teardown users will have to now open a photo and swipe to Metadata. After this, they just have to tap on three dots in the People section and tap on the hide face option. Users can choose to either reduce the frequency of a person's appearance or completely block them from showing up in any photo memories.
Article Summary: Google Photos is making a significant upgrade to its Memories feature, giving users more control over which faces appear in their nostalgic photo collages. The tech giant is rolling out a new tool that simplifies the process of hiding individuals from appearing in Memories. Google hasn't officially announced a release date for the new feature, but it’s anticipated to be available to users in the coming months.

Article Title: Anand Mahindra on AI: …is going to be of significantly more value to us than we imagined
Article Text:
How X users reacted to Anand Mahindra’s post

Anand Mahindra said that artificial intelligence (AI) can be of more value to mankind than ‘imagined’. Citing a research that showed how AI can detect breast cancer five years before it develops, he wrote "If this is accurate, then AI is going to be of significantly more value to us than we imagined and much earlier than we had imagined,".The Mahindra Group chairman took to microblogging platform X (formerly known as Twitter) to share his views.Recently, a team of researchers from Duke University in the US developed a new AI model to predict 5-year breast cancer risk from mammograms.Traditional cancer diagnosis relies on biopsies, microscopic histological examinations, and imaging techniques like MRI, CT, and PET scans. Human interpretation of these tests can be subjective. AI, on the other hand, can analyse medical images with staggering accuracy.An IANS report quotes Vineet Nakra, a radiation oncologist at Max Super Speciality Hospital on how AI is helping in cancer diagnosis and treatment. She told the news agency that AI is helping pathologists diagnose cancer much faster and paving the way for doctors to make personalised and patient-centric cancer care.Commenting on Mahindra’s X post, a user wrote “That's the best use of technology anyway. Assisting human kind to become better and reduce risks”. “AI in the medical field will have a huge impact and will certainly make significant contributions. Google DeepMind's AI system, AlphaFold3, can accurately predict the 3D structure of proteins and has potential applications in drug discovery and understanding diseases,” commented another.“AI, Machine Learning, Big data analysis based systems will drastically improve the living standards of life of every strata of society,” replied a third.
Article Summary: The Mahindra Group chairman took to microblogging platform X to share his views. He cited a research that showed how AI can detect breast cancer five years before it develops. Traditional cancer diagnosis relies on biopsies, microscopic histological examinations, and imaging techniques like MRI, CT, and PET scans.

Article Title: WhatsApp shut down in India: IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw says ‘the company has not…’
Article Text:
“People use WhatsApp because…”

IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw stated that neither WhatsApp nor its parent company Meta have informed the government of any plans to shut down their services in India. He made this statement in response to a question raised in the Rajya Sabha recently.“[The] Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) has shared that WhatsApp or Meta has not informed the government about any such plans,” Vaishnaw said in a written reply to a question by Congress member Vivek Tankha, as per PTI report on Friday (July 26).Tankha had asked whether WhatsApp was planning to shut its services in India due to the government's directives to share user details in accordance with the government directions under Section 69A of the Information Technology Act, 2000.Responding to Tankha's question on curbs on social media platforms, the I&B minister said the central government issued directions in the interest of the sovereignty or integrity of India, defence of India, security of the state, friendly relations with foreign states or public order or for preventing incitement to the commission of any cognisable offence relating to above in respect of the information on a computer resource.Earlier this year, WhatsApp told the Delhi High Court that it will stop functioning in India if it is compelled by the government to break encryption of messages.Previously, WhatsApp challenged the newly amended IT Rules saying that they violate the right to privacy and were unconstitutional. WhatsApp told the Delhi High Court that its end-to-end encryption protects user privacy by ensuring only the sender and recipient can access message content.“As a platform, we are saying, if we are told to break encryption, then WhatsApp goes,” Tejas Karia, appearing for Whatsapp, told a Division Bench. He added that people use WhatsApp because of the privacy features that it offers.“India (is) a country that’s at the forefront... You’re leading the world in terms of how people and businesses have embraced messaging,” Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg had said in a virtual address at Meta’s annual event last year.WhatsApp has more than 400 million users in India, making it the largest market for the platform.
Article Summary: IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw stated that neither WhatsApp nor its parent company Meta have informed the government of any plans to shut down their services in India. He made this statement in response to a question raised in the Rajya Sabha recently.

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has reduced the basic customs duty on mobile phones, chargers, and some components as part of the Union Budget 2024, addressing a major demand from the electronics manufacturing industry. Currently, imported smartphones sold in India are subject to 18% GST and 22% customs duty (20% basic and 2% surcharge). The 10% surcharge on the basic customs duty will remain unchanged.Following the reduction, the total customs duty is now 16.5% (15% basic and 1.5% surcharge). For phones manufactured in India, only the 18% GST is applied. Apple imports its iPhone Pro and Pro Max models, while its other smartphones are produced locally.Post this announcement, Apple has reduced prices of iPhones in India. While the price cut on base models non-Pro is almost negligible at Rs 300, the cut on high end Pro models is up to Rs 6,000. Here are the new prices of iPhones as they appear on Apple's official store in India.Apple has already updated its website with the new prices of the iPhone. The iPhone 15 Pro and iPhone 15 Pro Max models have received a discount of up to Rs 6,000. In comparison, the iPhone 15 and iPhone 15 Plus have received less discounts.Furthermore, the affordable iPhone SE has got a price cut of Rs 2,300 and is now available for Rs 47,600 (down from Rs 49,900). Similarly, the iPhone 13 and iPhone 14 models are selling at prices of Rs 59,600 and Rs 69,600, respectively.Here’s our table comparison of all the iPhone models that are currently listed on Apple’s website.
Article Summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has reduced the basic customs duty on mobile phones, chargers, and some components as part of the Union Budget 2024. Apple imports its iPhone Pro and Pro Max models, while its other smartphones are produced locally. Post this announcement, Apple has reduced prices of iPhones in India. While the price cut on base models non-Pro is almost negligible, the cut on high end Pro models is up to Rs 6,000.

Article Title: CrowdStrike outage: Microsoft now wants to keep away the access of Windows Kernel from these companies
Article Text: Following a major outage caused by a faulty CrowdStrike update last week, Microsoft is pushing for significant changes to Windows security architecture. The incident, which impacted 8.5 million PCs, has led Microsoft to reassess the resilience of its operating system and consider restricting kernel-level access for third-party security vendors .John Cable, Microsoft's vice president of program management for Windows servicing and delivery, outlined the company's stance in a blog post titled "Windows resiliency: Best practices and the path forward." Cable emphasised the need for "end-to-end resilience" and hinted at potential changes that could restrict kernel access for security software.The CrowdStrike update bug, which resulted in widespread system crashes, has highlighted the risks associated with allowing third-party applications to operate at the kernel level. This privileged access, while beneficial for threat detection, can lead to catastrophic failures if errors occur.Microsoft is now exploring alternatives that don't rely on kernel access, such as VBS enclaves and the Azure Attestation service. These technologies, which utilize Zero Trust approaches, could provide enhanced security without the risks associated with kernel-level operations.The tech giant's push for change may face resistance from cybersecurity vendors and regulators. A similar attempt to restrict kernel access in Windows Vista in 2006 was met with opposition. In contrast, Apple successfully locked down kernel access in macOS in 2020.Microsoft's approach involves collaboration with partners and the broader security community. The company aims to balance improved system resilience with the needs of security vendors who have historically relied on kernel-level access for their products.Microsoft's response to the CrowdStrike incident also included deploying over 5,000 support engineers to assist affected organizations and providing ongoing updates through the Windows release health dashboard. The company has emphasized the importance of business continuity planning, secure data backups, and utilizing cloud-native approaches for managing Windows devices to enhance resilience against future incidents.
Article Summary: Microsoft is pushing for changes to its Windows security architecture. The move follows a major outage caused by a faulty CrowdStrike update last week. The incident, which impacted 8.5 million PCs, has led Microsoft to reassess the resilience of its operating system.

Article Title: ChatGPT maker OpenAI testing SearchGPT: 4 key things to know about the AI-powered search engine set to take on Google
Article Text:
SearchGPT in testing phase right now

What OpenAI said about SearchGPT

OpenAI to take on Microsoft Bing and Perplexity, along with Google

SearchGPT may look like Google Overview

(With agency inputs)

OpenAI is testing an artificial intelligence-powered search engine that can access information from across the internet in real time. The prominent AI startup revealed the new prototype, SearchGPT , in a blog post earlier this week. OpenAI plans to integrate its new search engine technology with its existing online chatbot, ChatGPT. In a blog post, Microsoft-backed OpenAI said that the company plans to integrate the best features from the search tool into ChatGPT in the future.Here are the key things to know about SearchGPT.The company said it was testing the technology with a small group of users as well as online publishers who partnered with OpenAI to help build the search engine.“Getting answers on the web can take a lot of effort, often requiring multiple attempts to get relevant results,” the company said in its blog post. “We believe that by enhancing the conversational capabilities of our models with real-time information from the web, finding what you’re looking for can be faster and easier,” it added. Users will be able to interact with SearchGPT through conversational queries, and can ask follow-up questions as they might if speaking to a person, OpenAI said.Other than the search giant Google , SearchGPT launch, announced earlier this week, places the AI giant in competition with its largest backer Microsoft's Bing search and emerging services such as Perplexity — a search-focused AI chatbot firm backed by Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and semiconductor giant Nvidia . According to web analytics firm Statcounter, Google dominates the search engine market with a 91.1% share as of June 2024.Google recently added AI-generated query result summaries -- referred to as "Overviews" -- to its search engine. This new feature offers written text at the top of results for Google searches, ahead of the traditional links to websites, which summarizes information that the engine believes answers the user's search query. The description shared by OPenAI of SearchGPT appears similar to Google's Overviews.
Article Summary: OpenAI is testing an artificial intelligence-powered search engine that can access information from across the internet in real time. The AI startup revealed the new prototype, SearchGPT, in a blog post earlier this week. OpenAI plans to integrate its new search engine technology with its existing online chatbot, ChatGPT.

Article Title: UK, EU question Elon Musk’s X over use of data to train Grok AI: What they said
Article Text:
Also Read:

How X’s auto-consent flouts tech rules in the UK, EU

Elon Musk-owned X recently enabled by default a setting that allows the social media platform to utilise user data to train its AI model, Grok. This means X can use user posts, interactions, and outputs from Grok for training and refining its AI, requiring users to manually opt-out. Now the regulators in the UK and the European Union ( EU ) have reportedly connected with the company over its alleged attempt to gain user consent for data harvesting without their approval.While X claims this data is essential for improving user experience, privacy concerns have been raised. The setting states that users “allow your posts as well as your interactions, inputs and results with Grok to be used for training and fine-tuning”.Users have expressed difficulty in disabling this feature as the option is currently hidden within the web app's settings and unavailable on the mobile app.The move contradicts the tech laws in both the regions as the regulations prohibit pre-ticked consent boxes. Tech companies are not allowed to use “pre-ticked boxes” or “any other method of default consent”.Data protection authorities in the UK and Ireland have expressed their concerns over X's actions, as per a report by the Guardian. The UK's Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) is investigating the matter, emphasising the importance of transparency and user choice in data usage.“Platforms seeking to use their users’ data to train their AI foundation models must be transparent about their activities,” said a spokesperson for the ICO.“They should take steps to proactively notify users well in advance of using data for these purposes, and provide people with ample time and simple processes to object to having their data used in this way,” the spokesperson added.Similarly, Ireland's Data Protection Commission (DPC), the lead regulator for X in the EU, has expressed surprise at the development and is seeking further information from the company.“The DPC has been engaging with X on this matter for a number of months, with our latest interaction occurring as recently as yesterday, therefore we are surprised by today’s developments. We have followed up with X today (July 26) and are awaiting a response. We expect further engagement early next week,” said Graham Doyle, a DPC deputy commissioner.
Article Summary: X recently enabled by default a setting that allows the social media platform to utilise user data to train its AI model, Grok. This means X can use user posts, interactions, and outputs from Grok for training and refining its AI, requiring users to manually opt-out. Now the regulators in the UK and the European Union ( EU ) have reportedly connected with the company over its alleged attempt to gain user consent for data harvesting.

Article Title: Oppo K12x 5G debut in India with MediaTek Dimensity 6300 processor and 32MP camera: Price and other details
Article Text:
Oppo K12x 5G price and availability

Oppo K12x 5G features

Oppo took the wraps off its K12x 5G phone in India today. The smartphone comes with a starting price of Rs 12,999 and is claimed to be the toughest phone under Rs 15K. It comes with a 360-degree damage-proof armour body. Powered by a MediaTek chip, the device has a 5,100mAh battery with 45W SuperVOOC charger. Here are the detailsOppo K12x 5G has two RAM variants - 6GB and 8GB paired with 128GB and 256GB storage capacities.The 6GB RAM model costs Rs 12,999, while the 8GB RAM model is priced at Rs 15,999. The handset will be available in the country via Flipkart along with Oppo online stores and offline retail stores across the country.First sale of Oppo K12x 5G starts August 2 at 12 noon. Breeze Blue and Midnight Violet are the colour options that buyers can choose from.As far as the features are concerned, Oppo K12x 5G has a 6.67-inch 120Hz Ultra Bright display with 1000 nits of peak brightness. The smartphone has a 7.68 mm slim casing and weighs about 186 grams.The handset is said to have a 360° damage-proof armour body and comes with military standard certified - IP54 water and dust resistance design. Oppo K12x 5G houses a 5,100mAh battery and comes with 45 W SUPERVOOC Flash Charge.The Oppo K12x 5G smartphone comes powered by MediaTek Dimensity 6300 chipset based on 6nm architecture. It offers up to 8GB RAM expansion. On the camera front, the smartphone boasts of a 32MP AI main camera with 2MP secondary camera. For selfies and video calls, the phone has an 8MP camera at the front.
Article Summary: Oppo took the wraps off its K12x 5G phone in India today. The smartphone comes with a starting price of Rs 12,999 and is claimed to be the toughest phone under Rs 15K. Powered by a MediaTek chip, the device has a 5,100mAh battery with 45W SuperVOOC charger.

Article Title: Microsoft outage: CrowdStrike CEO explains the 'logic' that went wrong
Article Text:
The 'logic' that went wrong in CrowdStrike update

The machines impacted as per CrowdStrike

A faulty software update from US-based cybersecurity company CrowdStrike caused widespread disruptions on Friday, impacting critical services from airlines and banks to hospitals and stock exchanges. Millions of Microsoft Windows computers worldwide were rendered inoperable for several hours, and may across the world still continue to.In a blog post, CrowdStrike CEO George Kurtz, has explained what exactly may have caused the global outage.The post also shares a how-to guide for customers to fix the issue. There's also a root cause analysis. CrowdStrike emphasized that the incident was not a result of a cyberattack and that the issue has been resolved. Systems that downloaded the faulty update between 9:30 AM and 10:57 AM IST were most affected."On July 19, 2024 at 04:09 UTC, as part of ongoing operations, CrowdStrike released a sensor configuration update to Windows systems. Sensor configuration updates are an ongoing part of the protection mechanisms of the Falcon platform. This configuration update triggered a logic error resulting in a system crash and blue screen (BSOD) on impacted systems," wrote Kurtz.The CEO claimed that the issue has been rectified, "The sensor configuration update that caused the system crash was remediated on Friday, July 19, 2024 05:27 UTC.""Customers running Falcon sensor for Windows version 7.11 and above, that were online between Friday, July 19, 2024 04:09 UTC and Friday, July 19, 2024 05:27 UTC, may be impacted. Systems running Falcon sensor for Windows 7.11 and above that downloaded the updated configuration from 04:09 UTC to 05:27 UTC – were susceptible to a system crash," said the blog post.
Article Summary: Faulty software update from US-based cybersecurity company CrowdStrike caused widespread disruptions on Friday. Millions of Microsoft Windows computers worldwide were rendered inoperable for several hours. CrowdStrike emphasized that the incident was not a result of a cyberattack and that the issue has been resolved.

Article Title: WazirX suspends trading after $230 million loss: What 'India Ka Bitcoin Exchange' said on losing nearly half its reserves
Article Text:
Biggest Crypto hack in recent times

Hackers may have links to North Korea

WazirX, the leading Indian cryptocurrency exchange, has temporarily suspended all trading activities following a devastating cyberattack that drained nearly half of its reserves. The exchange that calls itself ' India Ka Bitcoin Exchange ' revealed in a post on X (formerly Twitter) on July 21 that hackers managed to steal approximately $230 million worth of crypto assets.The breach exploited a vulnerability in the exchange's multi-signature wallet system, compromising the security of stored funds. To mitigate further losses and ensure the protection of remaining assets, WazirX has temporarily halted customer withdrawals."Trading has been temporarily paused. The cyber attack theft has impacted our ability to maintain 1:1 collaterals with assets, and we've temporarily paused trading. We're conducting thorough forensic data examination and security audit procedures and working to enable withdrawals soon. User safety remains our top priority. Thank you for your patience and support during this challenging time. We will continue to provide regular updates 🙏," read the post.Based on the Cyvers estimate, the amount lost from the multiple-signature wallet on WazirX would be one of the biggest crypto thefts in recent years and comes just a month after Japanese crypto exchange DMM Bitcoin lost over $300 million in a hackThe incident is said to have raised concerns about the exchange's security protocols and its ability to safeguard user funds. Some are also questioning WazirX's claim of maintaining a 1:1 collateral ratio with assets, sparking fears among investors about potential losses.In an attempt to recover the stolen funds, WazirX has launched a bounty program offering up to $23 million for information leading to the arrest of the culprits and the return of the stolen assets. Preliminary investigations by risk-management firm Elliptic suggest that the hackers may have links to North Korea.Elliptic said in a blog post that hackers affiliated with North Korea appear to have carried out the hack. “The North Korea attribution is based on similarities in the types of services used by these hackers in the past, as well as similarities in their transactional behavior,” Tom Robinson, co-founder of Elliptic, said in an email.
Article Summary: WazirX, the leading Indian cryptocurrency exchange, has temporarily suspended all trading activities following a devastating cyberattack. The breach exploited a vulnerability in the exchange's multi-signature wallet system, compromising the security of stored funds. Preliminary investigations by risk-management firm Elliptic suggest that the hackers may have links to North Korea.

Article Title: Karnataka reservation bill: PhonePe CEO and founder Sameer Nigam issues this 'personal statement'
Article Text:
Read PhonePe CEO Sameer Nigam’s personal note

“PhonePe was born in Bengaluru and we are incredibly proud of our roots in this city, which is well known for its world-class technology talent and vibrant diversity. From Bengaluru, over the past decade we have expanded across the length and breadth of India and been able to deliver secure and efficient digital payments for over 55 Crore Indians.

Bengaluru's reputation as the "Silicon valley of India" is truly well-deserved. The city thrives on an incredible culture of innovation, and attracts the most brilliant young minds from Karnataka and the rest of India. As a company, we are deeply grateful for the supportive business environment that Karnataka’s governments and its local

Kannadiga

populace have offered us. Without such an inclusive ecosystem and progressive policies, Bengaluru would not have become a global technology superpower.

As a company we also thrive on celebrating diversity, we have always tried hard to deliver fair, unbiased and meritocracy-based employment opportunities for all Indians - including to all local Kannadigas. We believe such an approach gives every Indian a good job a chance to shine, and ultimately helps create more societal and economic value for Bengaluru, Karnataka and India.

I read some recent media articles, relating to a few personal comments that I made last week regarding the draft job reservation bill. I would first and foremost like to clarify that it was NEVER my intention to insult Karnataka and it’s people. If my comments hurt anyone’s sentiments in such a way, I am truly sorry and would like to offer you an unconditional apology. I have the highest regard for Kannada, and all other Indian languages. In fact, I truly believe that linguistic diversity and rich cultural heritage is a national asset that all Indians should be proud of; and all Indians should be respectful of and celebrate local and cultural norms.

Bengaluru’s Indian startups are competing against trillion dollar giants like Google, Apple, Amazon and Microsoft. To do so, these companies must be able to employ the very best talent available in India purely based on their technology skills and proficiency in fields such as Coding, Design, Product Management, Data Sciences, Machine Learning, AI and beyond. As a nation, that is the only way we can build world-class companies that can compete in the global village that we live in today.

I also want to help create lakhs of jobs for Bengaluru and Karnataka. And, I believe with more dialogue and discussion, we can find ways to create more sustainable employment avenues. Let’s all work together to do this meaningfully and while creating long-term impact.”

PhonePe CEO Sameer Nigam issued a personal note following backlash over his comments on Karnataka 's job reservation bill. The controversy erupted after Nigam criticised the bill on social media platform X, questioning whether his children deserved jobs in their home city given his company's pan-India job creation."If my comments hurt anyone's sentiments, I am truly sorry and would like to offer you an unconditional apology," Nigam said in a statement.He emphasised his 22-year connection to Bengaluru and respect for linguistic diversity.The Karnataka Cabinet had recently approved a bill mandating 50% reservation for locals in management roles and 70% in non-management positions within private companies. The bill, which also proposed 100% quota for locals in certain government jobs, was put on hold after industry backlash.Nigam stressed the need for merit-based hiring to build globally competitive companies. He reaffirmed PhonePe's commitment to Karnataka, stating the company plans to create thousands of new jobs in the state.
Article Summary: PhonePe CEO Sameer Nigam issued a personal note following backlash over his comments on Karnataka's job reservation bill. The controversy erupted after Nigam criticised the bill on social media platform X. Nigam emphasised his 22-year connection to Bengaluru and respect for linguistic diversity.
